query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Quando ambedue li figli di Latona, 2 coperti del Montone e de la Libra, 3 fanno de l’orizzonte insieme zona,
query.error: **English:** 1 When both the children of Latona, 2 covered by the Ram and the Scales, 3 make of the horizon a single zone,
query.result: 1 Yada ubhau Latāyāḥ putrāv, 2 Meṣa-Tulā-rāśibhyām āvṛtau, 3 Kṣitijasaṃsthānam ekam kurutaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 quant’ è dal punto che ’l cenìt inlibra 5 infin che l’uno e l’altro da quel cinto, 6 cambiando l’emisperio, si dilibra,
query.error: **English:** 4 as much as from the point where the zenith balances 5 until one and the other from that belt, 6 changing hemispheres, balances itself,
query.result: 4 Yāvat tat-binduto yatra madhyāhnaḥ tulām ārohati 5 Yāvad ubhau tat-mekhalayāḥ, 6 Ardhagolasya parivartanena, tulām ārohatām,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 tanto, col volto di riso dipinto, 8 si tacque Bëatrice, riguardando 9 fiso nel punto che m’avëa vinto.
query.error: **English:** 7 so much, with her face painted with laughter, 8 Beatrice was silent, gazing fixedly 9 at the point that had conquered me.
query.result: 7 Tāvān, hasitasundara-vadanā, 8 Mām abhibhūya yena binduḥ sa, 9 Tatraiva dṛṣṭim nidadhatī, Mādhavī munimuvāca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Poi cominciò: «Io dico, e non dimando, 11 quel che tu vuoli udir, perch’ io l’ho visto 12 là ’ve s’appunta ogne ubi e ogne quando.
query.error: **English:** 10 Then he began: "I say, and do not ask, 11 what you wish to hear, for I have seen it 12 there where every where and every when is fixed.
query.result: 10 Tataḥ sa ārabhata: "Aham bruve, na ca pṛcchāmi, 11 Yat tvam śrotum icchasi, yataḥ aham tad adṛkṣam 12 Tatrāpyatra sarvam yatra sarvam kadācit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Non per aver a sé di bene acquisto, 14 ch’esser non può, ma perché suo splendore 15 potesse, risplendendo, dir “Subsisto”,
query.error: **English:** 13 Not to have for itself a good acquired, 14 which cannot be, but so that its splendor 15 might, by shining, say “I exist”,
query.result: 13 Na svayam śubhasya labdhasya siddhyartham, 14 yat sambhavati na, kim tu yasya tejas 15 prakāśamānam evam vaditum śaknuyāt “Aham asmi”,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 in sua etternità di tempo fore, 17 fuor d’ogne altro comprender, come i piacque, 18 s’aperse in nuovi amor l’etterno amore.
query.error: **English:** 16 in its eternity of time before, 17 outside of every other comprehension, as it pleased it, 18 the eternal love opened itself in new loves.
query.result: 16 tasya nityatve kālasya pūrvam, 17 sarvasmād anyād bodhād bahiḥ, yathā tasmai rocate, 18 nūtaneṣu premeṣu anādir premaḥ prakāśitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Né prima quasi torpente si giacque; 20 ché né prima né poscia procedette 21 lo discorrer di Dio sovra quest’ acque.
query.error: **English:** 19 Nor did it lie dormant before, as it were; 20 for neither before nor afterwards 21 did the discourse of God proceed over these waters.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Forma e materia, congiunte e purette, 23 usciro ad esser che non avia fallo, 24 come d’arco tricordo tre saette.
query.error: **English:** 22 Form and matter, joined and yet distinct, 23 came forth to be that which had no fault, 24 like three arrows from a three-stringed bow.
query.result: 22 Rūpaṃ ca dravyaṃ ca, yuktāvyaktī, 23 nirgatam asti bhāvāya yasya na doṣaḥ, 24 yathā dhanuṣaḥ triguṇasya triḥ śarāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 E come in vetro, in ambra o in cristallo 26 raggio resplende sì, che dal venire 27 a l’esser tutto non è intervallo,
query.error: **English:** 25 And as in glass, or amber, or crystal, 26 a ray gleams so that between its coming 27 and its being there is no interval,
query.result: 25 Evaṃ kāca iva, raktāmbarake vā, sphāṭike vā 26 raśmiḥ prakāśate, yataḥ āgamanaṃ 27 bhāvatvāt sarvam nāsti antaram,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 così ’l triforme effetto del suo sire 29 ne l’esser suo raggiò insieme tutto 30 sanza distinzïone in essordire.
query.error: **English:** 28 so the threefold effect of its Maker 29 in its own being shone forth all at once 30 without distinction in its beginning.
query.result: 28 tathā svāminaḥ trividhaḥ kāryaḥ 29 svabhāve tasya prakāśante sarve ekaḥ kālaḥ 30 abhede āvirbhāve.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Concreato fu ordine e costrutto 32 a le sustanze; e quelle furon cima 33 nel mondo in che puro atto fu produtto;
query.error: **English:** 31 Order was created and constructed 32 for the substances; and they were the summit 33 in the world in which pure act was produced;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 pura potenza tenne la parte ima; 35 nel mezzo strinse potenza con atto 36 tal vime, che già mai non si divima.
query.error: **English:** 34 pure potency held the lowest part; 35 in the middle, potency with act 36 was so tightly bound that it can never be divided.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Ieronimo vi scrisse lungo tratto 38 di secoli de li angeli creati 39 anzi che l’altro mondo fosse fatto;
query.error: **English:** 37 Jerome wrote to you at great length 38 about the centuries of the created angels 39 before the other world was made;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 ma questo vero è scritto in molti lati 41 da li scrittor de lo Spirito Santo, 42 e tu te n’avvedrai se bene agguati;
query.error: **English:** 40 but this truth is written in many places 41 by the writers of the Holy Spirit, 42 and you will perceive it if you pay close attention;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 e anche la ragione il vede alquanto, 44 che non concederebbe che ’ motori 45 sanza sua perfezion fosser cotanto.
query.error: **English:** 43 and reason also sees it to some extent, 44 for it would not allow that the movers 45 should be so long without their perfection.
query.result: 43 yuktiś ca etad alpaśaḥ paśyati, 44 yā na samīkaroti yathā cetanāḥ 45 svayaṃ-pūrṇatām vinā tathā bhaveyuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Or sai tu dove e quando questi amori 47 furon creati e come: sì che spenti 48 nel tuo disïo già son tre ardori.
query.error: **English:** 46 Now you know where and when these loves 47 were created and how: so that quenched 48 in your desire are now three ardors.
query.result: 46 Adyaiva tvam jānāsi kutra kadā ca ete premāḥ 47 asṛjyata katham ca: yataḥ samāptāḥ 48 tava icchāyām adya trayaḥ dahakāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Né giugneriesi, numerando, al venti 50 sì tosto, come de li angeli parte 51 turbò il suggetto d’i vostri alimenti.
query.error: **English:** 49 You would not reach, counting, to twenty, 50 so quickly, as a part of the angels 51 disturbed the subject of your nourishment.
query.result: 49 Na gacchethāḥ, ganayant, viṃśatiṃ 50 tathā tvaritam, yathā devatā-gaṇaḥ 51 vyākulaṃ cakāra yūṣasya viṣayam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 L’altra rimase, e cominciò quest’ arte 53 che tu discerni, con tanto diletto, 54 che mai da circüir non si diparte.
query.error: **English:** 52 The other remained, and began this art 53 that you discern, with so much delight, 54 that it never departs from its circuit.
query.result: 52 Aparā avasiṣṭā, sā ca ayam kalā 53 yām paśyasi, atipriyeṇa, 54 yā na kadācid api paridhiḥ parityajati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Principio del cader fu il maladetto 56 superbir di colui che tu vedesti 57 da tutti i pesi del mondo costretto.
query.error: **English:** 55 The beginning of the fall was the accursed 56 pride of him whom you saw 57 weighed down by all the weights of the world.
query.result: 55 Patanasya ārambhaḥ abhavat śāpitaḥ 56 abhimānaḥ tasya yam tvam apaśyaḥ 57 sarvalokadhāmabhiḥ pīḍitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Quelli che vedi qui furon modesti 59 a riconoscer sé da la bontate 60 che li avea fatti a tanto intender presti:
query.error: **English:** 58 Those whom you see here were modest 59 in acknowledging their own goodness, 60 which had made them so ready to understand:
query.result: 58 Ye atra paśyasi te vinītāḥ āsīt 59 ātmanaḥ śubhatayā jñātum 60 yā teṣām etāvat boddhum kṣipraṃ cakāra:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 per che le viste lor furo essaltate 62 con grazia illuminante e con lor merto, 63 si c’hanno ferma e piena volontate;
query.error: **English:** 61 therefore their vision was exalted 62 with illuminating grace and with their own merit, 63 so that they have firm and full will;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 e non voglio che dubbi, ma sia certo, 65 che ricever la grazia è meritorio 66 secondo che l’affetto l’è aperto.
query.error: **English:** 64 and I do not want you to doubt, but be certain, 65 that receiving grace is meritorious 66 according to how open one's affection is to it.
query.result: 64 na ca icchāmi yathā tvaṃ saṃdehaṃ kuruṣva, api tu niścitaḥ bhava, 65 yathā anugrahaṃ prāpnoti puṇyakarmaṇā 66 yathā tasya snehaḥ tasya prati anuṣaktaḥ asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Omai dintorno a questo consistorio 68 puoi contemplare assai, se le parole 69 mie son ricolte, sanz’ altro aiutorio.
query.error: **English:** 67 Around this assembly you can now behold 68 much, if my words are gathered up, without 69 other aid.
query.result: 67 Asya sabhāyāḥ paritaḥ adhunā paśyasi 68 bahu, yadi mama vacāṃśaṃgṛhṇīṣe, vinā 69 anyena sāhāyyena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Ma perché ’n terra per le vostre scole 71 si legge che l’angelica natura 72 è tal, che ’ntende e si ricorda e vole,
query.error: **English:** 70 But why on earth do your schools teach 71 that angelic nature 72 is such that it understands, remembers, and wills,
query.result: 70 Api ca kena hetu bhūtale tava pathashālāsu 71 pathyate yad angelika prakṛtiḥ 72 evamrūpā yathā jānāti smarate ca ichchati ca,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 ancor dirò, perché tu veggi pura 74 la verità che là giù si confonde, 75 equivocando in sì fatta lettura.
query.error: **English:** 73 I will say more, so that you may see purely 74 the truth that is confused down there, 75 equivocating in such a reading.
query.result: 73 punar api vakṣyāmi, yena tvam paśyeḥ śuddham 74 satyam yat tatra adhastād viparītam bhavati, 75 vipratipadyamānam evamrūpe pathane.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Queste sustanze, poi che fur gioconde 77 de la faccia di Dio, non volser viso 78 da essa, da cui nulla si nasconde:
query.error: **English:** 76 These substances, after they were joyful 77 in the presence of God, did not turn their face 78 from Him, from whom nothing is hidden:
query.result: 76 Etāni tattvāni, yadā ānandamayāni āsīt 77 Bhagavataḥ purataḥ, na avavartayanta mukham 78 tasmāt, yasya kim api na gūḍham asti:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 però non hanno vedere interciso 80 da novo obietto, e però non bisogna 81 rememorar per concetto diviso;
query.error: **English:** 79 therefore they have their vision uninterrupted 80 by any new object, and therefore there is no need 81 to recall by divided thought;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 sì che là giù, non dormendo, si sogna, 83 credendo e non credendo dicer vero; 84 ma ne l’uno è più colpa e più vergogna.
query.error: **English:** 82 so that there, without sleeping, one dreams, 83 believing and not believing that one speaks the truth; 84 but in the one there is more fault and more shame.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Voi non andate giù per un sentiero 86 filosofando: tanto vi trasporta 87 l’amor de l’apparenza e ’l suo pensiero!
query.error: **English:** 85 You do not go down a path 86 philosophizing: so much does 87 the love of appearances and the thought of it transport you!
query.result: 85 Na yūyam adhastāt gacchatha ekasmin panthāni 86 tattvajñānam ārabhya: tāvatīm yūyān prati 87 rūpasya snehaḥ, tasya ca cintā!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 E ancor questo qua sù si comporta 89 con men disdegno che quando è posposta 90 la divina Scrittura o quando è torta.
query.error: **English:** 88 And even this up here is tolerated 89 with less disdain than when 90 the divine Scripture is neglected or twisted.
query.result: 88 Api ca ayam atraiva upari vartate 89 alpam anadarāt, yadā apahṛtā 90 devī śāstra-saṁhitā, vā vikṛtā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Non vi si pensa quanto sangue costa 92 seminarla nel mondo e quanto piace 93 chi umilmente con essa s’accosta.
query.error: **English:** 91 One does not think how much blood it costs 92 to sow it in the world, and how much it pleases 93 him who humbly approaches it.
query.result: 91 Na cintayatē yāvat raktaṃ bhavati 92 asyāṃ loke vapane, yāvat ca priyatā 93 yasya vinītena asyāṃ samparkaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Per apparer ciascun s’ingegna e face 95 sue invenzioni; e quelle son trascorse 96 da’ predicanti e ’l Vangelio si tace.
query.error: **English:** 94 To appear, each one exerts himself and makes 95 his own inventions; and these are spread abroad 96 by the preachers, and the Gospel is silent.
query.result: 94 Prakāśitum sarvaḥ prayatate karoti ca 95 svān kalpanān; tāśca pracaritāḥ santi 96 pravaktribhiḥ, śāstram tu maunam āpannam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Un dice che la luna si ritorse 98 ne la passion di Cristo e s’interpuose, 99 per che ’l lume del sol giù non si porse;
query.error: **English:** 97 One says that the moon turned away 98 in the passion of Christ and interposed itself, 99 so that the light of the sun would not shine down;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 e mente, ché la luce si nascose 101 da sé: però a li Spani e a l’Indi 102 come a’ Giudei tale eclissi rispuose.
query.error: **English:** 100 and he thinks that the light hid 101 of its own accord: therefore to the Spaniards and to the Indians 102 as to the Jews such an eclipse responded.
query.result: 100 Tataś ca manyate yac chvetaḥ prakāśaḥ svayam eva 101 Ātmānaṃ gopāyati sma: tasmāt Spāniyeṣu, Indeṣu ca 102 Yathā Yahuḍīyeṣu tādṛśaḥ grahaṇaḥ pratipadyate sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Non ha Fiorenza tanti Lapi e Bindi 104 quante sì fatte favole per anno 105 in pergamo si gridan quinci e quindi:
query.error: **English:** 103 Florence has not so many Lapi and Bindi 104 as there are such fables cried out every year 105 from the pulpits here and there:
query.result: 103 Na asti Florence nāma nagare tāvat Lapi Bindi nāmakāḥ, 104 yāvatīḥ etāḥ kathāḥ prativatsaraṃ 105 mañceṣu uccair ucyante iha ca atra ca:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 sì che le pecorelle, che non sanno, 107 tornan del pasco pasciute di vento, 108 e non le scusa non veder lo danno.
query.error: **English:** 106 so that the little sheep, who do not know, 107 return from pasture fed on wind, 108 and their not seeing the harm does not excuse them.
query.result: 106 yathā meṣyāḥ yāḥ na jānanti, 107 paścāt paścād vāyunaḥ pānena pūritāḥ āgacchanti, 108 na ca tāḥ kṣamāḥ santi naṣṭasya dravyasya adarśanāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 e quel tanto sonò ne le sue guance, 113 sì ch’a pugnar per accender la fede 114 de l’Evangelio fero scudo e lance.
query.error: **English:** 112 and so much did it resound in their faces, 113 that to fight for kindling the faith 114 of the Gospel they made shield and lance.
query.result: 112 Tathā ca tat teṣāṃ vadaneṣu prakaṭīkṛtam āsīt, 113 Yathā Suviśeṣasya viśvāsam uttejayan 114 Suviśeṣasya eva kavacaṃ śaktiṃ ca cakratuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Ora si va con motti e con iscede 116 a predicare, e pur che ben si rida, 117 gonfia il cappuccio e più non si richiede.
query.error: **English:** 115 Now one goes with jests and mockeries 116 to preach, and even if one speaks well, 117 one puffs up one's hood and nothing more is required.
query.result: 115 Adyaiva yāti vākyaiḥ parihāsaiśca 116 Upadesam kartum, yadi vā subhāṣitam, 117 Phullitam śirastraṃ, na punar apiyācyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ma tale uccel nel becchetto s’annida, 119 che se ’l vulgo il vedesse, vederebbe 120 la perdonanza di ch’el si confida:
query.error: **English:** 118 But such a bird nestled in its little beak, 119 that if the common people saw it, they would see 120 the forgiveness in which it trusts:
query.result: 118 Api tu tādṛśaḥ pakṣī tasya tuṇḍe nidrāṃ cakāra, 119 yadi laukikaḥ janaḥ tam paśyet, tadā sa paśyet 120 kṣamāṃ yasmin sa viśvāsam karoti:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 per cui tanta stoltezza in terra crebbe, 122 che, sanza prova d’alcun testimonio, 123 ad ogne promession si correrebbe.
query.error: **English:** 121 because of which so much foolishness grew on earth, 122 that, without proof of any testimony, 123 people would rush to any promise.
query.result: 121 yasmāt hetoḥ pṛthivyāṃ tādṛśī mūḍhatā avardhata, 122 yataḥ, kasyāpi pratyakṣa-pramāṇasya vinā, 123 sarvāsu pratītiṣu janaḥ dhāvati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Di questo ingrassa il porco sant’ Antonio, 125 e altri assai che sono ancor più porci, 126 pagando di moneta sanza conio.
query.error: **English:** 124 Saint Anthony fattens himself on this, 125 and many others who are even greater hogs, 126 paying with counterfeit money.
query.result: 124 Anena sant’antoniaḥ śūkaraḥ puṣyati, 125 anye ca bahvaḥ ye adhikaśūkarāḥ santi, 126 adrāṅkitahiranyena krayaṇam kṛtvā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Ma perché siam digressi assai, ritorci 128 li occhi oramai verso la dritta strada, 129 sì che la via col tempo si raccorci.
query.error: **English:** 127 But why have we digressed so much? Now turn 128 your eyes back to the straight road, 129 so that the journey may be shortened with time.
query.result: 127 Kimartham punar bahu vivakṣitam asmābhiḥ, adhunā 128 Netre punar āvartaya satpathaḥ prati, 129 Yathā kālena mārgaḥ samkṣipyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Questa natura sì oltre s’ingrada 131 in numero, che mai non fu loquela 132 né concetto mortal che tanto vada;
query.error: **English:** 130 This nature so abounds 131 in number, that never was speech 132 or mortal concept that could reach so far;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 e se tu guardi quel che si revela 134 per Danïel, vedrai che ’n sue migliaia 135 determinato numero si cela.
query.error: **English:** 133 and if you look at what is revealed 134 by Daniel, you will see that in his thousands 135 a definite number is concealed.
query.result: 133 ca yadi tvam paśyasi yat prakāśyate 134 Dāniyēlena, drakṣyasi yatra tasya sahasreṣu 135 niścitam saṅkhyānam gūḍham asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 La prima luce, che tutta la raia, 137 per tanti modi in essa si recepe, 138 quanti son li splendori a chi s’appaia.
query.error: **English:** 136 The first light, which all the region illumines, 137 is received in it in so many ways, 138 as are the splendors to which it is conjoined.
query.result: 136 Prathamaṃ prakāśaḥ, yaḥ samastaṃ viṣayaṃ prakāśayati, 137 Tathāvidhāni bahūnī rūpāṇi tasminn ādīyante, 138 Yathā teṣāṃ tejām̐sīṃ, yeṣāṃ saḥ sannidhiṃ gacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Onde, però che a l’atto che concepe 140 segue l’affetto, d’amar la dolcezza 141 diversamente in essa ferve e tepe.
query.error: **English:** 139 Where, however, at the moment that it conceives, 140 the affection follows, of loving the sweetness 141 in it boils and rages differently.
query.result: 139 Yatra tu yaḥ kālaḥ kalpanāyāḥ, 140 tataḥ anantaram snehaḥ sambhavati, 141 tasyām eva madhuratām abhilasya vividhairūpeṇa sphuritum ārabhate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Vedi l’eccelso omai e la larghezza 143 de l’etterno valor, poscia che tanti 144 speculi fatti s’ha in che si spezza,
query.error: **English:** 142 Now you see the height and the breadth 143 of the eternal value, since so many 144 mirrors have been made in which it is broken up,
query.result: 142 Adya tvam paśyasi mahimānam ca vistāraṃ ca 143 nityasya mūlyasya, yataḥ etāvatīni 144 darpaṇāni kṛtāni santi, yeṣu tad bhinnam asti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 uno manendo in sé come davanti».
query.error: **English:** 145 one remaining in itself as before.
query.result: 145 ekena ātmāni sthitena pūrvavat.
